moves.1. c4: I won this game with a bishop sac on the kingside and a devastating fork.  I begin with the English Opening trying to get my opponent into unfamiliar lines.
moves.2. g3: Preparing to fianchetto my bishop to take advantage of the light squares in the center.
moves.2... Nc6 3. Nc3: I delay fianchetto to develop my c knight and prevent e4
moves.3... Bc5: It is fairly common in the King's English to attack the f2 square early.
moves.4. Bg2: Now I have control of d5.
moves.5. Nf3: I develop my f knight for castling. I am not worried about e4 here because Ng5 wins the e4 pawn.
moves.5... d5: I have lost control of d5 with the knight move and he takes advantage of this
moves.6. cxd5 Nxd5 7. d3: Preparing for e4 and attacking the centralized knight.
moves.7... O-O 8. O-O Be6: black tries to hold on to d5 with this move, now all of his minor pieces are developed.
moves.9. Ng5: attacking the bishop and threatening to double up his pawns on the e file
moves.10. Nxe6: I take the bishop and double up his pawns on the e-file.
moves.10... fxe6 11. Bg5: I develop my dsb and pin his knight to his queen
moves.11... Rf7: Better to move the queen than make a risky move with taking the rook off the back rank.
moves.12... h6: He attacks my bishop and as you can see on the next move I sac it to blow away his kingside.  I know by analysing that I will get equal compensation for the bishop back.
moves.13. Bxh6: The bishop sac which defined the character of this game.
moves.13... gxh6 14. Qg4+: I immediately exploit his destroyed kingside and win compensation for the bishop.
moves.14... Rg7 15. Qxe6+: He forgot about his pawn on e6.
moves.15... Kh8 16. Qxh6+: Now we are equal in material and Ive destroyed his kingside, ive just got to get more pieces into the attack.
moves.16... Rh7 17. Qf6+ Kg8 18. Ne4: I get my knight into play attacking his bishop while joining the Queen in the attack.
moves.18... Bb6 19. Ng5: Attacking his rook now he cant use it to attack my queen.
moves.19... Rg7 20. Qe6+ Kf8 21. Qf6+ Kg8: I need another piece in the attack so I decide to use my fianchettoed bishop
moves.22. Be4 Kh8: black should not be worried by 23. Bh7+ because RxB NxR KxR and things are evened out.  Instead he makes a whale of a blunder with Kh8 as I fork the Queen and the King
